content:
Does anyone on here know any details about this initiative and whether HL7 standards play a part in the solution?...

https://www.iata.org/en/programs/passenger/travel-pass/
Not sure; we're using FHIR directly in https://smarthealth.cards (and https://vaccinationcredential.org).
Again not sure but I'm expecting English citizens will be able to use an App to show test+vaccination status (and this would be FHIR based).
The dutch (and EU commision) are having some experiments on it and are using protobuf: https://github.com/minvws/nl-eHealth-experimental
If I remember correctly they said (3weeks ago) they are running HL7 v 2.5.x but are working on moving it to FHIR.

Jens Villadsen said:

The dutch (and EU commision) are having some experiments on it and are using protobuf: https://github.com/minvws/nl-eHealth-experimental

Code System for Immunization.vaccineCode is "2.16.840.1.113883.2.4.4.40.76" - what does that represent?

HL7 Europe will organize a webconference on Interoperable Proof of Vaccination Implementation approaches across Europe on 25 February 2021, 16-18 h CET / 10 am EST USA. More info and registration link: https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/3988777909994055947.

Fredrik Lindén said:

Vaccinetype https://decor.nictiz.nl/jeugdgezondheidszorg/jgz-html-20140528T125924/tmp-2.16.840.1.113883.2.4.6.10.100.116-2012-08-01T000000.html DKTB-Hib so basic vaccinations

So, basically a local code system?
